newsitem.title: UK: MOTOR RACING-WILLIAMS PROVE DOMINANT IN FINAL TESTING.
newsitem.headline: MOTOR RACING-WILLIAMS PROVE DOMINANT IN FINAL TESTING.

text.p: German Heinz-Harald Frentzen finished fastest on Thursday as Williams Renault ended six days of testing at Estoril in Portugal.
Frentzen recorded a time of one minute 18.93 seconds as Canadian team mate Jacques Villeneuve, who posted a lap record of 1:18.36 on Tuesday, was rested.

Despite team boss Frank Williams's court case over Ayrton Senna's death starting in Imola, Italy on Thursday, Frentzen and Villeneuve proved they were still favourites for the individual and team Formula One accolades this season.
Benetton drivers Frenchman Jean Alesi and Austrian Gerhard Berger were also in fine form on their final test outing, and clocked 1:19.00 secs and 1:19.53 seconds respectively.
"The test has gone well for me," said Alesi. "I am pleased with the reliability of the car. I am now looking forward to the start of the season."
